intro: Carex enysii, commonly known as Enys' sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist to wet habitats, such as marshes and along stream banks. The plant has grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale yellow to brown flowers. It is native to eastern North America and is often found in the southeastern United States. Carex enysii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates and birds.
